column4: What's a good way to troubleshoot slow network issues on ubuntu 10.10? I have a Realtek 8112L network card and my internet (and networks) speeds are terrible in ubuntu
I've tried disabling ipv6, using the driver directly from realtek, etc. But none of it makes any difference
I seem to remember that the realtek had a known issue.
Any solutions that you remember? I've tried everything I can think of
Yeah
wait one sec.
Thanks :)
I'm using 64 bit if that makes any difference
what kernel version?
2.6.35-22-generic
you have any old kernels still installed?
No, this was actually a fresh install of 10.10. I went back and tested and even the live cd gives me issues
I was on 9.10 before and didn't have issues, but I forget what kernel version I was using
what I had found, and found again was that there were posts from users stating that after 2.6.32-24 kernel upgrade, the 8112L was slow
That was 32bit though... I'm wondering if the 64bit driver is just no good.
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1540347
Hmm.. that sucks. I'd rather not be stuck on an old version. I will take a look at that thread though
try this one... http://www.jamesonwilliams.com/realtek-8112l-on-linux  it sounds like this jameson williams guy wrote a driver.
Thanks for the link. I will give that a try!
sorry man. that is the best I can do for you.
yw.
